website_summaries.verdict: One of the best ways to get the best video output from a Thunderbolt 3 docking station.
pros: Docking station features an integrated Nvidia GTX 1050 graphics card for independent visual processing
Thunderbolt 3 ports are capable of the fastest 40 Gbps data transfer speeds
cons: Guaranteed compatibility with the external GPU is limited to other Lenovo devices

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the graphics dock with an HP Spectre on its internal display for a little over a month now, and I'm happy to report that it works exactly as I was hoping it would. The dock itself seems well built and compact, and even though the external power adapter is sadly about the same size, the complete setup is still very portable and relatively light. Graphics performance is about what one would expect from a 1050 - which is to say, good enough for just about anything you would want to run.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Works with my Lenovo 920 Yoga
customer_reviews.text: First thing i did was plug the eGPU into the wall outlet, then into my laptop before powering on the laptop. Turns out this thing doubles as a power adapter for my laptop as well so that's pretty convenient. The manual for this eGPU says to download and install a PC firmware first before installing the drivers, but i ignored the firmware and just installed the drivers. That was all it took for my laptop to start running games with this eGPU. While i liked how easy it is to set this thing up and how portable it is compared to other eGPUs, the performance provided by the GTX 1050 4gb is kinda lacking compared to other GTX 1050s.
customer_reviews.author: Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had worked better
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for an employee that had the need for video processing but didn't want a desktop or a larger laptop. Initially the device seemed to work, however it would run into issues shortly after. Cutting out the display, 1050 would no longer be detected, and the dock would fail to function. The only way to bring it back was to unplug the machine, and unplug the dock and let it sit, after an undefined amount of time you could hook it back up and get it working. This was not a sustainable solution so we went ahead and returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: Landin

customer_reviews.title: Little expensive, but convienant and portable!
customer_reviews.text: Mine was lost in transit and I had to buy it elsewhere, but I am happy with this. I am using it on a lenovo yoga 730, I lose about 15 percent performance compared to a standard 1050 in benchmarks, but this also a 4gb card, opposed to 3gb. When running it back to the laptop I saw pretty much no difference in performance compared to running to an external monitor, but make sure you have a 40Gbps cable and device that supports it. No you aren't gonna play games at 4k at high settings, but I'm happy I can play ESO at max settings at 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: Braheem

customer_reviews.title: *** Tested, Works with X1 Carbon 6G & T470 ***
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to drive my AW3418DW 1440p u l t r a w i d e during the day and the 1050 inside is more like a 1050ti with the 4GB of VRAM... It will play 1080p games in med settings just fine on a 34" UW.... Tremendous if you are vested in the ThinkPads, are an enthusiast/collector, or looking for something small and sexy to drive a few panels and not take up a ton of desk space. The sweet spot on value is if you can score this under 300$ be patient if you can find one.
customer_reviews.author: MANEK

customer_reviews.title: Working (mostly) fine with my Thinkpad X380
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged it in, it ran terrible for about an hour. I eventually rebooted and everything was more or less fine after that. It can run PUBG on low settings with acceptable FPS. (typically 30-90 depending on what's happening). It has crashed running Unreal Editor a few times. It gives a blue screen and says something about video & nvidia in the message. Nothing else so far has triggered a blue screen. The form factor is amazing and I hope they release a 20 series card like this eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not Plug and play never worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Lenovo X1 6th Gen laptop, sure with a TB port. I've owned Lenovo products for 20 years. After much tweaking and downloading drivers (thunderbolt, firmware NVIDIA, etc, etc) it worked miraculously one time but after rebooting never got it to work again. This is a half baked product from Lenovo, readme.txt files are in some "chinenglish" not very easy to understand, you can tell the seudo-quality control Lenovo went through. Beware don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Amaya

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your time. Mine stopped powering on in less than 7 months. When I called for support my unit had no serial number. Beware product may be a fraud.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Great for professional work and medium detail 1080p gaming
customer_reviews.text: One down side all USB ports are on the front, and the fan is noticeable but not any louder than the laptop cpu ( 730 13 in i5 at full boost), works great with my 21:9 ultra wide full HD monitor and the 4 gig 1050 scores the same benchmark performance as the desktop varient. The 4 lanes pcie on my yoga 730 is amazing for external hdd storage
customer_reviews.author: joshua bommer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Was like new. Does include a cable. On a X1 yoga 3rd took my fps from 16 to 70 fps in bf4. Drivers are updateable from Nvidia, as well. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Ayad

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Paired with my HP Spectre x360 (i7 CPU, 16 gigs RAM) it runs League of Legends in 4k at 150 FPS. That's all I wanted it to do. Set up was weird though... when I first installed it was crashing my computer every time I plugged it in. You are going to need to install Nvidia's driver in addition to the Lenovo one. Or maybe just the Nvidia one and NOT the Lenovo one. Bottom line, I had to fiddle with the drivers to get it to work, and but eventually I got it to work... somehow. Haven't had any issues since initial installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dock for X1C6
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dock. Using it with my X1 Carbon 6th gen. Nice to have one cable dock and power the laptop. To get it working, I had to: install the drivers, reboot, connect the dock, reinstall the drivers, reboot.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett N

customer_reviews.title: Even better than advertised!  Fantastic eGPU!
customer_reviews.text: Major improvement over my previous dock. Is very very smoothly driving 2x27" LGs ( No longer taxes my laptop's GPU, no more lag, no more stuttering on my Lenovo Yoga X1 Carbon (2nd Gen 2017).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: Graphics Dock does not work with my Dell XPS 13 :(
customer_reviews.author: sge

customer_reviews.title: Great portable eGPU
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have it on a flat surface, as the vent on the bottom needs to be unobstructed. Not a great main GPU, but if you travel for work like I do, it's easy to fly with and allows you to game on your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes won't connect..
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes is finniky.. Allows gaming at 1080p with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Sigma008

customer_reviews.title: Works great as well with Lenovo Thinkpad P52
customer_reviews.text: I bought this e-GPU Graphic to have a small mobile solution for KVM (Kernel based Virtual Machine) GPU pass through to the virtual machine. Works great, no issues for this purposes on a Thinkpad P52, even if from the description it is not explicitly supported as far as I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS OETTLI

customer_reviews.title: The only eGPU you can slide into your laptop bag.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it with my Lenovo X1 Tablet so the very small size helps keep the entire setup portable. Does the job I need it for and also allows me to play some games as well. If you need a very slim and portable eGPU this is a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Chaoticmass

customer_reviews.title: Unstable for T470
customer_reviews.text: System crashed many times during the past 1.5 years, unknown reasons. Unstable product for T470.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but tech support was poor.
customer_reviews.text: Product worked but it was a bit difficult to configure.
customer_reviews.author: Keyan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works with Lenovo X1 Yoga Gen 3 laptop
customer_reviews.text: Initially plugged into Lenovo laptop X1 Yoga Gen 3 and just caused blue screen of death constantly, but then installed Lenovo Vantage to update the drivers required for the dock, and eventually ran smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver B.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk avoid
customer_reviews.text: It keeps disconnecting. Windows won't recognize it as an external device after the latest update. No instruction manual came with the device, what little documentation exists is partially in Chinese.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schulz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value , Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Its an amazing upgrade , turns your average laptop into a nice gaming desktop , it runs dota 2 high settings 80FPS @ 4k , was really surpised , and now i no longer need to buy a gaming setup , i can game freely on my work laptop! , best value product iv ever bought !!
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed A.

customer_reviews.title: Compatable with Lenovo Yoga 720 15inch
customer_reviews.text: I have a yoga 720 15 inch and it works great as an external graphics card and am able to extend to 3 external monitors, it doesn't work if the computer is closed however
customer_reviews.author: Rmen

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes PC freeses
customer_reviews.text: Works great! You can run graphic software or games on usual business laptop but works not so stable. Sometimes issues when connect device and freezes happens.
customer_reviews.author: Despod1981

customer_reviews.title: Heat from gpu core. Heat management.
customer_reviews.text: Despite of loud noise from fan, massive heat from the gpu core.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Experience very good
customer_reviews.text: 3 shortcomings, the lightning 3 line is very short. High heat. The firmware could not be updated. The latest nvidia drivers can be installed.
customer_reviews.author: chenhummer

product_meta.title: Lenovo G0A10170UL Thunderbolt 3 Graphics Dock
product_meta.description: Create the most productive and space-saving workstation for your ultrabooks with the Lenovo Thunderbolt 3 Graphics Dock. Featuring an integrated NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 graphics card, you can have the benefit of the ultrabook’s sleek portability and still do graphics-heavy work and play. Powered by innovative Intel Thunderbolt 3 technology, enjoy up to 40 Gbps lightning-fast data transfer and experience a definitive 4K video performance with up to three external displays. At the same time, the graphics dock provides stable, reliable, and continuous power to your Ultrabook and mobile devices with the Thunderbolt port and always-power-on USB 3.0 port.
feature_bullets: PLAY OR WORK LIKE A PRO: Amplify your ultrabook’s graphics performance with the integrated NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 graphics card. Load games or edit videos at higher frame rates and better details from the added graphics boost.

BENEFIT OF ULTRABOOK, EXPERIENCE OF A DESKTOP: Get a desktop-like experience from your Ultrabook with Lenovo Thunderbolt 3 Graphics Dock via a suite of video and USB ports for your display and peripheral needs. Enjoy Ultrabook portability when mobile and dock to three 4K displays at home or office.

DISCOVER NEW WORLDS WITH WINDOWS MR: Upgrade your IdeaPad 720s 13" (8th Generation Intel CPU, 8 GB RAM) experience with Lenovo Explorer Headset and Lenovo Thunderbolt 3 Graphics dock. The graphics dock supports Windows Mixed Reality at 90 Hz performance to deliver immersive and powerful mixed reality.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars64 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
